summary: Frontend testing of multi-tenant drag and drop CMS for school websites. Critical authentication session issue preventing complete testing of drag and drop functionality. Editor interface loads successfully but redirects to login after brief moments.

critical_bugs.issue: Editor page redirects to login after successful authentication - session not persisting
critical_bugs.impact: Prevents users from accessing editor functionality after login

integration_issues.issue: Authentication session drops when accessing editor page

passed_tests: Login page loads correctly with demo credentials
Editor interface components load initially (widgets sidebar, canvas, toolbar)
14 widgets found in sidebar (Hero Section, Text Block, Heading, Image, Button, Features Grid, etc.)
3 device view buttons present (Desktop, Tablet, Mobile)
Component action buttons (copy/delete) visible in canvas
Demo content renders on canvas (hero section, features section)
No JavaScript console errors during editor load
success_percentage: Frontend: 40% (Authentication and initial UI loading works, but editor access fails due to session issues)
action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: Fix authentication session management for editor page access. The editor loads briefly but immediately redirects to login page, preventing testing of core drag-and-drop functionality. Check: 1) Session persistence in React Router protected routes, 2) JWT token expiration and refresh, 3) Authentication context provider, 4) Editor route protection logic.
